title: Sprint 02: Object-Oriented Mastery
description: Deep dive into PHP's OOP features, from structure to advanced design principles including SOLID.
items: 01- Class Anatomy: Readonly classes, New instance syntax, Constructor property promotion
02- Visibility & Encapsulation: public/protected/private impact, Typed properties, Uninitialized state
04- Inheritance Dynamics: Abstract classes vs Interfaces, final keyword, 'extends' best practices
05- Interfaces & Polymorphism: Contract-based programming, Type hinting interfaces over classes
06- Traits: Horizontal code reuse, Conflict resolution (insteadof, as), Composition over inheritance
07- Enums: Unit Enums, Backed Enums, Enum methods and interfaces (PHP 8.1+)
08- Attributes: Native PHP Attributes syntax (#[Attr]), Reflection access basics
09- Static & Constants: Late Static Binding (static:: vs self::), Class constants visibility
10- Anonymous Classes: Usage in testing, one-off objects, and dynamic implementations
11- Dependency Injection: Constructor injection, Setter injection concepts, Inversion of Control
12- SOLID - SRP: Single Responsibility Principle - Extracting logic to specialized classes
13- SOLID - OCP: Open/Closed Principle - Designing for extension without modification
14- SOLID - LSP & ISP: Liskov Substitution & Interface Segregation Principles
15- SOLID - DIP: Dependency Inversion - Programming to abstractions/interfaces
